mods.abstract: The 105-foot water tower at Belmont University, circa July 1978. This feature of architectural interest was constructed circa 1850. The water tower originally irrigated the gardens and provided water for the fountains at the estate of Colonel Joseph and Adelicia Acklen. During the Civil War it was used by Federal soldiers to relay signals. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
